page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT
page.content: In the South East unemployment is not such a problem as elsewhere in the country and this is reflected in the fact that almost all the fathers in our survey had a job. About half of the men work locally, including Burnham, Maldon Southend and Chelmsford, but a substantial number commute to London by train. Only just over half of the mothers had a job and by far the greatest number of these work in Southminster itself. There is an estate of some nine factories for light industrial use and this employs about 300 people. The Power Station at Bradwell is the biggest single employer in the area.
